translations.6017683769837067192: Hmm, we can't connect to the ReadAlongs API. Please try again later.
translations.1614347125196988603: Failed to initialize the aligner. This may be the result of an incompatible browser. Please {$START_LINK}{$START_TAG_MAT_ICON}mail{$CLOSE_TAG_MAT_ICON} contact the developers{$CLOSE_LINK} and send them a complete copy of the error message below:
translations.4441973805993808330: Failed to retrieve the list of languages from the server. Please {$START_LINK}{$START_TAG_MAT_ICON}mail{$CLOSE_TAG_MAT_ICON} contact the developers{$CLOSE_LINK} and reload the page once the error is corrected.
translations.7504412437394032605: Whoops! Looks like you're lost! You weren't supposed to see this page. Please go back to the home page by clicking below.
translations.6818717224121299397: Hmm, the file is unreachable. Please try again later.
translations.1309246714146466494: Creating a ReadAlong is easy!    This guide will show you all the bells and whistles of the Studio.
translations.2521339316382884905: To make your ReadAlong, you'll need to add your text and audio.
translations.6934589696014916904: You can write your text directly into ReadAlong Studio, by selecting the "write" option.
translations.8203636039276427127: You can also use text from a plain text file (.txt) or a file in the RAS format (.readalong).
translations.4200696836052759670: You can record your own audio for preprocessing using your browser's microphone.
translations.8374880530284796780: You can also select either a .wav or .mp3 file for your ReadAlong.
translations.1653005571499433141: Then, select the language of your ReadAlong. We support over 30 different languages, but if your language is not here, you can try using the Undetermined (und) option. If that doesn't work very well, you can always add your own language. This requires some understanding of your language's writing system. Feel free to reach out to us or visit our blog posts for more information.
translations.6491013634569415627: Once you've done this, you can click the "next step" button here to let Studio build your ReadAlong! (This may take a few seconds.)
translations.5383048139152066599: Now your ReadAlong has been created.
translations.8760815604043544159: Pressing play will play the audio and highlight the text at the same time. Try it out!
translations.6136458453037527406: Clicking on an individual word will play it as well.
translations.2372754282380446808: You can edit the text here to add a Title or Subtitle to your ReadAlong.
translations.463112944111781294: You can add an image to each page of your ReadAlong here.
translations.8141623860318291592: You can add a translation or extra bit of information to each sentence of your ReadAlong by clicking on the + icon here. If you later want to remove the translation, click on the âˆ’ icon after adding your translation.
translations.9028584152057075057: When you're happy with your ReadAlong, you can export it by selecting a download format and then clicking on the download button (down arrow). You can choose from the following formats:
translations.2010852928670878114: Offline HTML: your ReadAlongs in a single-file HTML document that requires no web access to work
translations.1034483059001175624: Elan and Praat files: export formats used by documentary linguists
translations.4531999879654619327: SRT and WebVTT subtitles: export formats used to add subtitles to videos
translations.121261747461955932: If you'd like to change your audio or text you can always go back to Step 1 and change things or make a new ReadAlong.
translations.668489750030842261: But be careful, going back to the previous step will mean you will lose all of your translations and images.
translations.3430021493872613524: Warning: Using the browser's back button will leave the app and might also erase all your text and audio data, so it should be avoided.
translations.5849788734463744687: Instead, use the "Step 1" button to go back and change your text or audio.
translations.9145384756401372637: We have built this tool with the top goal of respecting your privacy and data sovereignty. The audio that you use on this site {$START_BOLD_TEXT}does not get uploaded anywhere{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}. It will stay on your computer. The text you use for this Read Along will be uploaded over an encrypted connection to a server for preprocessing. The text is not saved and is not used for any other purpose. Using this site means that you agree for your data to be used in this way.
translations.3354727320770003649: Almost every website you visit will collect data about you using Web Analytics tools which can come with a variety of privacy concerns. We have opted to use {$START_LINK}Plausible Analytics{$CLOSE_LINK}, which incurs a cost for us but ensures that the data gathered about your visit here is not sold and respects your privacy. We use this data to determine how many people access the site, which devices they use, and other metrics used to make improvements to the site. For a full list of what is collected, please view {$START_LINK_1}Plausible's data policy{$CLOSE_LINK}. For a less jargon-y example of the kind of data we see, you can visit this {$START_LINK_2}demonstration site here{$CLOSE_LINK}. In any case, you can opt out entirely by clicking the "Opt Out" button below (you can always opt back in later).
translations.3614618598824071164: This is a tool to help you make your own interactive 'readalong' that highlights words as they are spoken. Have a look at {$START_LINK}{$START_TAG_MAT_ICON}launch{$CLOSE_TAG_MAT_ICON} this example in East Cree{$CLOSE_LINK} to get a better idea of what these are.
translations.11480612528390167: To get started making your own, read our {$START_LINK}privacy and data sovereignty policy{$CLOSE_LINK}, then take a tour by clicking on the tour button below, and follow the steps below.
translations.5448899278320615037: Create your own offline compatible interactive multimedia stories that highlight words as they are spoken.
translations.4019963252146086342: Interactive ReadAlong that highlights text as it is spoken
translations.4939253261247981581: You already started some work, though, so clicking next will erase it and continue the tour with demonstration data. Cancel the tour if you don't want to do this.
translations.2050258905855699260: Here is how to format your plain text input text.
translations.7402655112347006322: Each line should ideally contain one sentence, although that is not a strict rule.
translations.1565438668041183426: Paragraph breaks are indicated by inserting a blank line.
translations.6597490123856497618: Page breaks are indicated by inserting two consecutive blank lines.
translations.6487299681734040440:
This is sentence one in paragraph one on page one.
This is sentence two in paragraph one on page one.

This is sentence one in paragraph two on page one.
This is sentence two in paragraph two on page one.


This is sentence one in paragraph one on page two.
translations.8835207011849408799: Select data to start creating your ReadAlong
translations.5649094541771811015: In order to make a ReadAlong, we need 3 different things. We need to know {$START_BOLD_TEXT}which language{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} your readalong is in, and we also need some {$START_BOLD_TEXT}text{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}, and corresponding {$START_BOLD_TEXT}audio{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}.
translations.323794992596449638: Select a plain text file (.txt) or a ReadAlong Studio temporary file (.readalong)
translations.6329500169661407619: Write or paste your text here
translations.7124627482150867570: Use pre-recorded audio from an MP3 or WAV file.
translations.3662704049012244015: Select the language of your text and audio
translations.4946040406121957395: If your language isn't supported in the list below, you can try and run it with the "Undetermined" option below. If that's not working very well, have a look at {$START_LINK}{$START_TAG_MAT_ICON}launch{$CLOSE_TAG_MAT_ICON} this blog post series{$CLOSE_LINK} to understand how you might get support for your language, or {$START_LINK_1}{$START_TAG_MAT_ICON}mail{$CLOSE_TAG_MAT_ICON} contact us{$CLOSE_LINK} for more info!
translations.7797047079884673368: You can use the dropdown below to select a pre-configured mapping for your language.
translations.8804844169128591194:
Please listen to your audio to make sure it is clear and corresponds
to the text.
translations.4812680719296626428:
Your text may contain unpronounceable characters or numbers.
Please check it to make sure all words are spelled out completely, e.g. write "42" as "forty two".
translations.2596823344081631983: Audio was successfully recorded. Please listen to your recording to make sure it's OK, and save it for reuse if so.
translations.3585637900550692820: We couldn't record anything, is your microphone blocked or disconnected? If the problem persists please try with a headset or other microphone.
translations.1983793909601149790: Please try again, or select a pre-recorded file.
translations.4603453641249002294: Sorry, the alignment model isn't loaded yet. Please wait a while and try again if you're on a slow connection. If the problem persists, please contact us.
translations.7528020111424948593: Please (re-)record some audio or select an audio file.
translations.5640828320811588897: Please select or write text, select or record audio data, and select the language.
translations.1326685349515945581: processed, but not uploaded. Your audio will stay on your computer.
translations.2722548994886578004: processed. It will be uploaded through an encrypted connection when you go to the next step.
